H0.text: What hourglass-shaped women's garment was made using whalebone. Bustier

H1.text: What hourglass-shaped women's garment was made using whalebone. Girdle

H2.text: What hourglass-shaped women's garment was made using whalebone. Farthingale

H3.text: What hourglass-shaped women's garment was made using whalebone. Corset

A4.text: Structure is provided by boning (also called ribs or stays) inserted into channels in the cloth or leather. In the 18th and early 19th century, thin strips of baleen (also known as whalebone) were favoured for the boning

A5.text: The corset was the primary tool used to achieve this figure, along with padding in the skirt such as petticoats and bustles
